title: Application of Universal Design and Critical Librarianship for Inclusive Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of higher education curricula and foundational knowledge of DEI (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion) concepts
context.additional_context: Most learners are social sector professionals or activists, possessing digital device proficiency

learning_goals: Learners can design inclusive educational materials and activities utilizing universal design principles
Learners can analyze health disparities and information inequality cases by applying a critical librarianship approach
Learners can measure the effectiveness of educational programs using DEI (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion) assessment tools
Learners can implement at least three interaction strategies considering learner diversity in online environments

resources: Zoom and Collaboration Tools (Miro, Mentimeter, etc.)
Universal Design for Learning (UDL) Guidelines PDF

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
